intro: Thysanotus, commonly known as the star of Bethlehem, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Plantaginaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Thysanotus species typically have hairy stems and leaves, and they often thrive in well-drained, sandy soils. Many species are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens due to their delicate appearance. The genus includes approximately 30 species, most of which are perennial herbs.
